bill.title: School district consolidation; authorize State Board of Education to mandate where schools have failed for two consecutive years.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-17-6 And 37-17-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When Any School In A School District Meets The Definition Of A Failing School For Two Consecutive Years, The State Board Of Education Shall Abolish The School District, Appoint A Conservator To Administer The Schools Formerly In The District And Assign The Territory Formerly In The Abolished District To One Or More Contiguous School Districts; To Provide That The Local School Board Of The Receiving District Shall Consent To The Receipt Of The Territory Of The Abolished District; To Provide For The Transfer Of Real And Personal Property Of The Abolished District, New Teacher Contracts, Appointment Of Administrators, Adoption Of School Budgets And Final Approval Of The Mandatory Consolidation By The State Board Of Education; And For Related Purposes.
